intro: Thesium polycephalum, commonly known as the clustered thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically evergreen and arranged in a rosette pattern. Thesium polycephalum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
